channel.title: professional baseball club on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in professional baseball club on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 American Association of Professional Baseball Logo
The American Association of Professional Baseball is an independent professional baseball league founded in 2005. It operates in the central United States and Canada, mostly in cities not served by Major League Baseball teams or their minor league affiliates. Joshua Schaub is the league commissioner. League offices are located in Moorhead, Minnesota. Though a separate entity, the league shared a commissioner and director of umpires with the Canadian American Association of Professional Baseball during that league’s existence.
You can download theAAPBlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: AAPB
item.description: The American Association of Professional Baseball is an independent professional baseball league founded in 2005. It operates in the central United States and Canada, mostly in cities not served by Major League Baseball teams or their minor league affiliates. Joshua Schaub is the league commissioner. League offices are located in Moorhead, Minnesota. Though a separate entity, the league shared a commissioner and director of umpires with the Canadian American Association of Professional Baseball during that league’s existence.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Atlantic League of Professional Baseball Logo
The Atlantic League of Professional Baseball is a professional baseball league based in the United States. It is an official MLB Partner League based in the Mid-Atlantic and Southeastern United States. The Atlantic League’s corporate headquarters is located at Clipper Magazine Stadium in Lancaster, Pennsylvania. The Atlantic League operates in cities not served by Major League Baseball or Minor League Baseball teams; most of its teams are within suburbs and exurbs too close to other teams in the organized baseball system to have minor league franchises of their own.
You can download theALPBlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: ALPB
item.description: The Atlantic League of Professional Baseball is a professional baseball league based in the United States. It is an official MLB Partner League based in the Mid-Atlantic and Southeastern United States. The Atlantic League’s corporate headquarters is located at Clipper Magazine Stadium in Lancaster, Pennsylvania. The Atlantic League operates in cities not served by Major League Baseball or Minor League Baseball teams; most of its teams are within suburbs and exurbs too close to other teams in the organized baseball system to have minor league franchises of their own.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Altoona Curve Logo The Altoona Curve are a Minor League Baseball team based in Altoona, Pennsylvania, named after nearby Horseshoe Curve. The team plays in the Eastern League and is the Double-A affiliate of the Pittsburgh Pirates. The Curve play in Peoples Natural Gas Field, located in Altoona; it was opened in 1999 and seats 7,210 people. Source
You can download theAltoona Curvelogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Altoona Curve
item.description: The Altoona Curve are a Minor League Baseball team based in Altoona, Pennsylvania, named after nearby Horseshoe Curve. The team plays in the Eastern League and is the Double-A affiliate of the Pittsburgh Pirates. The Curve play in Peoples Natural Gas Field, located in Altoona; it was opened in 1999 and seats 7,210 people. Source

<! [CDATA[
Bowie Baysox Logo The Bowie Baysox are a Minor League Baseball team located in Bowie, Maryland. They are the Double-A affiliate of the Baltimore Orioles, and play in the Eastern League. Their home ballpark is Prince George’s Stadium. Source
You can download theBowie Baysoxlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Bowie Baysox
item.description: The Bowie Baysox are a Minor League Baseball team located in Bowie, Maryland. They are the Double-A affiliate of the Baltimore Orioles, and play in the Eastern League. Their home ballpark is Prince George’s Stadium. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Buffalo Bisons Logo
The Buffalo Bisons are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Toronto Blue Jays. Located in Buffalo, New York, the team plays their home games at Sahlen Field, the highest-capacity Triple-A ballpark in the United States. The current franchise was founded in 1979 and assumed the history of previous franchises that also used the Buffalo Bisons name, most notably the 1886–1970 Buffalo Bisons minor league franchise, and the 1879–1885 Buffalo Bisons major league franchise.
You can download theBuffalo Bisonslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Buffalo Bisons
item.description: The Buffalo Bisons are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Toronto Blue Jays. Located in Buffalo, New York, the team plays their home games at Sahlen Field, the highest-capacity Triple-A ballpark in the United States. The current franchise was founded in 1979 and assumed the history of previous franchises that also used the Buffalo Bisons name, most notably the 1886–1970 Buffalo Bisons minor league franchise, and the 1879–1885 Buffalo Bisons major league franchise.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Charlotte Knights Logo
The Charlotte Knights are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Chicago White Sox. They are located in Charlotte, North Carolina, and play their home games at Truist Field, which opened in 2014 and is located in Uptown Charlotte. The team previously played at Knights Park, Knights Castle, and Knights Stadium. Established as a Double-A franchise of the Southern League in 1976, the team was known as the Charlotte Orioles, or Charlotte O’s, through 1987.
You can download theCharlotte Knightslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Charlotte Knights
item.description: The Charlotte Knights are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Chicago White Sox. They are located in Charlotte, North Carolina, and play their home games at Truist Field, which opened in 2014 and is located in Uptown Charlotte. The team previously played at Knights Park, Knights Castle, and Knights Stadium. Established as a Double-A franchise of the Southern League in 1976, the team was known as the Charlotte Orioles, or Charlotte O’s, through 1987.

<! [CDATA[
Cleburne Railroaders Logo The Cleburne Railroaders are a professional baseball team based in Cleburne, Texas, that plays in the American Association of Professional Baseball, an official Partner League of Major League Baseball. The team, which began play in 2017, plays its home games at The Depot at Cleburne Station. Source
You can download theCleburne Railroaderslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Cleburne Railroaders
item.description: The Cleburne Railroaders are a professional baseball team based in Cleburne, Texas, that plays in the American Association of Professional Baseball, an official Partner League of Major League Baseball. The team, which began play in 2017, plays its home games at The Depot at Cleburne Station. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Delmarva Shorebirds Logo
The Delmarva Shorebirds are a Minor League Baseball team based in Salisbury, Maryland. They are members of the Carolina League and the Low-A affiliate of the Baltimore Orioles. Their home games are played at Arthur W. Perdue Stadium. The Shorebirds were members of the Class A South Atlantic League from 1996 to 2020, and of the Low-A East in 2021. They won two SAL championships, in 1997 and 2000. Also in 1997, the Shorebirds received Baseball America’s Bob Freitas Award for Class A baseball.
You can download theDelmarva Shorebirdslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Delmarva Shorebirds
item.description: The Delmarva Shorebirds are a Minor League Baseball team based in Salisbury, Maryland. They are members of the Carolina League and the Low-A affiliate of the Baltimore Orioles. Their home games are played at Arthur W. Perdue Stadium. The Shorebirds were members of the Class A South Atlantic League from 1996 to 2020, and of the Low-A East in 2021. They won two SAL championships, in 1997 and 2000. Also in 1997, the Shorebirds received Baseball America’s Bob Freitas Award for Class A baseball.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Durham Bulls Logo
The Durham Bulls are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Tampa Bay Rays. They are located in Durham, North Carolina, and play their home games at Durham Bulls Athletic Park. Originally established in 1902 as the Durham Tobacconists and disbanded and restarted numerous times over the years, the Bulls became internationally famous following the release of the 1988 movie Bull Durham starring Kevin Costner, Tim Robbins, and Susan Sarandon.
You can download theDurham Bullslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Durham Bulls
item.description: The Durham Bulls are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Tampa Bay Rays. They are located in Durham, North Carolina, and play their home games at Durham Bulls Athletic Park. Originally established in 1902 as the Durham Tobacconists and disbanded and restarted numerous times over the years, the Bulls became internationally famous following the release of the 1988 movie Bull Durham starring Kevin Costner, Tim Robbins, and Susan Sarandon.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
El Paso Chihuahuas Logo
The El Paso Chihuahuas are a Minor League Baseball team of the Pacific Coast League and the Triple-A affiliate of the San Diego Padres. They are located in El Paso, Texas, and play their home games at Southwest University Park, which opened in 2014. The Chihuahuas moved to El Paso from Tucson, Arizona, where they were known as the Tucson Padres. They played in the PCL until the 2021 restructuring of the minor leagues when they shifted to the Triple-A West, but this league was renamed the PCL in 2022.
You can download theEl Paso Chihuahuaslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: El Paso Chihuahuas
item.description: The El Paso Chihuahuas are a Minor League Baseball team of the Pacific Coast League and the Triple-A affiliate of the San Diego Padres. They are located in El Paso, Texas, and play their home games at Southwest University Park, which opened in 2014. The Chihuahuas moved to El Paso from Tucson, Arizona, where they were known as the Tucson Padres. They played in the PCL until the 2021 restructuring of the minor leagues when they shifted to the Triple-A West, but this league was renamed the PCL in 2022.

<! [CDATA[
Erie SeaWolves Logo
The Erie SeaWolves are an American professional baseball team based in Erie, Pennsylvania. They compete in Minor League Baseball as a member of the Eastern League’s Southwest Division, serving as the Double-A affiliate of the Detroit Tigers. The team was founded in 1989 and began playing in Erie for the 1995 season. The SeaWolves currently play their home games at UPMC Park in downtown Erie, a part of the Louis J.
You can download theErie SeaWolveslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Erie SeaWolves
item.description: The Erie SeaWolves are an American professional baseball team based in Erie, Pennsylvania. They compete in Minor League Baseball as a member of the Eastern League’s Southwest Division, serving as the Double-A affiliate of the Detroit Tigers. The team was founded in 1989 and began playing in Erie for the 1995 season. The SeaWolves currently play their home games at UPMC Park in downtown Erie, a part of the Louis J.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Florence Y'alls Logo
The Florence Y’alls are a professional baseball team based within the Greater Cincinnati region in the city of Florence, Kentucky. The Y’alls are a member of the West Division of the Frontier League, an independent baseball league. Since 2004, they have played their home games at Y’alls Ballpark, which is located near Interstates 71 and 75. The Y’alls franchise has won three Frontier League championships. However, these titles came when the team existed as the Erie Sailors, Johnstown Steal, and Johnstown Johnnies.
You can download theFlorence Yallslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Florence Yalls
item.description: The Florence Y’alls are a professional baseball team based within the Greater Cincinnati region in the city of Florence, Kentucky. The Y’alls are a member of the West Division of the Frontier League, an independent baseball league. Since 2004, they have played their home games at Y’alls Ballpark, which is located near Interstates 71 and 75. The Y’alls franchise has won three Frontier League championships. However, these titles came when the team existed as the Erie Sailors, Johnstown Steal, and Johnstown Johnnies.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Gary SouthShore RailCats Logo
The Gary SouthShore RailCats are a professional baseball team based in Gary, Indiana, in the United States. The RailCats are members of the American Association of Professional Baseball, an official Partner League of Major League Baseball. The RailCats started as a member of the Northern League in 2002, operating as a travel team for a season before moving in to U.S. Steel Yard in 2003, where they have played since.
You can download theGary SouthShore RailCatslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

The RailCats started as a member of the Northern League in 2002, operating as a travel team for a season before moving in to U.S. Steel Yard in 2003, where they have played since.

Gastonia Honey Hunters Logo The Gastonia Honey Hunters are a professional baseball team based in Gastonia, North Carolina. They play in the South Division of the Atlantic League of Professional Baseball, a “partner league” of Major League Baseball, at CaroMont Health Park in Gastonia, North Carolina. Source
You can download theGastonia Honey Hunterslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Grand Junction Rockies Logo
The Grand Junction Rockies are an independent baseball team of the Pioneer League, which is not affiliated with Major League Baseball but is an MLB Partner League. They are located in Grand Junction, Colorado, and play their home games at Suplizio Field. They are named for the Colorado Rockies, who were their major league affiliate from 2001 to 2020 prior to the league becoming independent. Their mascot is Corky Coyote.
You can download theGrand Junction Rockieslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Grand Junction Rockies
item.description: The Grand Junction Rockies are an independent baseball team of the Pioneer League, which is not affiliated with Major League Baseball but is an MLB Partner League. They are located in Grand Junction, Colorado, and play their home games at Suplizio Field. They are named for the Colorado Rockies, who were their major league affiliate from 2001 to 2020 prior to the league becoming independent. Their mascot is Corky Coyote.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Gwinnett Stripers Logo
The Gwinnett Stripers are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Atlanta Braves. They play their home games at Coolray Field in unincorporated Gwinnett County, Georgia in suburban Atlanta, Georgia. They are named for striped bass in reference to the popularity of fishing in the region. The team was established in 2009 after the International League’s Richmond Braves relocated from Richmond, Virginia.
You can download theGwinnett Striperslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Gwinnett Stripers
item.description: The Gwinnett Stripers are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Atlanta Braves. They play their home games at Coolray Field in unincorporated Gwinnett County, Georgia in suburban Atlanta, Georgia. They are named for striped bass in reference to the popularity of fishing in the region. The team was established in 2009 after the International League’s Richmond Braves relocated from Richmond, Virginia.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Indianapolis Indians Logo
The Indianapolis Indians are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Pittsburgh Pirates. They are located in Indianapolis, Indiana, and play their home games at Victory Field in downtown Indianapolis. The team’s mascot is Rowdie the Bear. Founded in 1902, the Indianapolis Indians are the second-oldest minor league franchise in American professional baseball. The 1902 and 1948 Indians were recognized as being among the 100 greatest minor league teams of all time.
You can download theIndianapolis Indianslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Indianapolis Indians
item.description: The Indianapolis Indians are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Pittsburgh Pirates. They are located in Indianapolis, Indiana, and play their home games at Victory Field in downtown Indianapolis. The team’s mascot is Rowdie the Bear. Founded in 1902, the Indianapolis Indians are the second-oldest minor league franchise in American professional baseball. The 1902 and 1948 Indians were recognized as being among the 100 greatest minor league teams of all time.

Inland Empire 66ers Logo The Inland Empire 66ers of San Bernardino are a Minor League Baseball team of the California League and the Low-A affiliate of the Los Angeles Angels. The 66ers are based in San Bernardino, California, and play at San Manuel Stadium. Source
You can download theInland Empire 66erslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Iowa Cubs Logo
The Iowa Cubs are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Chicago Cubs. They are located in Des Moines, Iowa, and are named for their Major League Baseball affiliate. The Cubs play their home games at Principal Park, which opened in 1992. They previously played at Sec Taylor Stadium from 1969 to 1991. The club was established as the Iowa Oaks of the Triple-A American Association in 1969.
You can download theIowa Cubslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Iowa Cubs
item.description: The Iowa Cubs are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Chicago Cubs. They are located in Des Moines, Iowa, and are named for their Major League Baseball affiliate. The Cubs play their home games at Principal Park, which opened in 1992. They previously played at Sec Taylor Stadium from 1969 to 1991. The club was established as the Iowa Oaks of the Triple-A American Association in 1969.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp Logo
The Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Miami Marlins. They are located in Jacksonville, Florida, and are named for shrimp caught in the area. The team plays their home games at 121 Financial Ballpark, which opened in 2003. They previously played at Sam W. Wolfson Baseball Park from 1962 until the end of the 2002 season. A team known as the Jacksonville Suns competed in the Triple-A International League from 1962 to 1968.
You can download theJacksonville Jumbo Shrimplogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp
item.description: The Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Miami Marlins. They are located in Jacksonville, Florida, and are named for shrimp caught in the area. The team plays their home games at 121 Financial Ballpark, which opened in 2003. They previously played at Sam W. Wolfson Baseball Park from 1962 until the end of the 2002 season. A team known as the Jacksonville Suns competed in the Triple-A International League from 1962 to 1968.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Joliet Slammers Logo
The Joliet Slammers are a professional baseball team based in Joliet, Illinois, that play in the independent Frontier League. They play their home games at DuPage Medical Group Field. They replaced the Joliet JackHammers of the Northern League after the franchise was crippled by numerous financial issues. The JackHammers franchise was put up for sale and Steel City Baseball, LLC, bought out all assets, including the front office, the ticketing system, and the lease of the ballpark.
You can download theJoliet Slammerslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Joliet Slammers
item.description: The Joliet Slammers are a professional baseball team based in Joliet, Illinois, that play in the independent Frontier League. They play their home games at DuPage Medical Group Field. They replaced the Joliet JackHammers of the Northern League after the franchise was crippled by numerous financial issues. The JackHammers franchise was put up for sale and Steel City Baseball, LLC, bought out all assets, including the front office, the ticketing system, and the lease of the ballpark.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Louisville Bats Logo
The Louisville Bats are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Cincinnati Reds. They are located in Louisville, Kentucky, and are named in dual reference to the winged mammal and baseball bats, such as those manufactured locally under the Louisville Slugger brand. The team plays their home games at Louisville Slugger Field, which opened in 2000. The Bats previously played at Cardinal Stadium from 1982 to 1999.
You can download theLouisville Batslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Louisville Bats
item.description: The Louisville Bats are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Cincinnati Reds. They are located in Louisville, Kentucky, and are named in dual reference to the winged mammal and baseball bats, such as those manufactured locally under the Louisville Slugger brand. The team plays their home games at Louisville Slugger Field, which opened in 2000. The Bats previously played at Cardinal Stadium from 1982 to 1999.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Memphis Redbirds Logo
The Memphis Redbirds are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the St. Louis Cardinals. They are located in Memphis, Tennessee, and are named for their Major League Baseball affiliate. The Redbirds play their home games at AutoZone Park, which opened in 2000 and is located in Downtown Memphis. The team previously played at Tim McCarver Stadium in 1998 and 1999. The Redbirds were established as an expansion team of the Triple-A Pacific Coast League in 1998.
You can download theMemphis Redbirdslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Memphis Redbirds
item.description: The Memphis Redbirds are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the St. Louis Cardinals. They are located in Memphis, Tennessee, and are named for their Major League Baseball affiliate. The Redbirds play their home games at AutoZone Park, which opened in 2000 and is located in Downtown Memphis. The team previously played at Tim McCarver Stadium in 1998 and 1999. The Redbirds were established as an expansion team of the Triple-A Pacific Coast League in 1998.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Mississippi Braves Logo The Mississippi Braves, or M-Braves as they are referred to locally, are a Minor League Baseball team based in Pearl, Mississippi, a suburb of Jackson. The team is the Double-A affiliate of the Atlanta Braves and plays in the Southern League. The team is owned and operated by Endeavor. Endeavor purchased the Braves from Liberty Media in 2022. Source
You can download theMississippi Braveslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

The team is the Double-A affiliate of the Atlanta Braves and plays in the Southern League. The team is owned and operated by Endeavor. Endeavor purchased the Braves from Liberty Media in 2022. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Modesto Nuts Logo
The Modesto Nuts are a Minor League Baseball team of the California League and the Low-A affiliate of the Seattle Mariners. They are located in Modesto, California, and are named for the several types of nuts grown in the region. They play their home games at John Thurman Field, which opened in 1955. The Nuts adopted their current name in 2005 after the team’s affiliation with the Oakland Athletics ended.
You can download theModesto Nutslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Modesto Nuts
item.description: The Modesto Nuts are a Minor League Baseball team of the California League and the Low-A affiliate of the Seattle Mariners. They are located in Modesto, California, and are named for the several types of nuts grown in the region. They play their home games at John Thurman Field, which opened in 1955. The Nuts adopted their current name in 2005 after the team’s affiliation with the Oakland Athletics ended.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Nashville Sounds Logo
The Nashville Sounds are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Milwaukee Brewers. They are located in Nashville, Tennessee, and are named for the city’s association with the music industry. The team plays their home games at First Horizon Park, which opened in 2015 and is located on the site of the historic Sulphur Dell ballpark. The Sounds previously played at Herschel Greer Stadium from its opening in 1978 until the end of the 2014 season.
You can download theNashville Soundslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Nashville Sounds
item.description: The Nashville Sounds are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Milwaukee Brewers. They are located in Nashville, Tennessee, and are named for the city’s association with the music industry. The team plays their home games at First Horizon Park, which opened in 2015 and is located on the site of the historic Sulphur Dell ballpark. The Sounds previously played at Herschel Greer Stadium from its opening in 1978 until the end of the 2014 season.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Ogden Raptors Logo
The Ogden Raptors are an independent baseball team of the Pioneer League, which is not affiliated with Major League Baseball but is an MLB Partner League. They are located in Ogden, Utah, and play their home games at Lindquist Field. Pitcher Ben Sheets, first baseman Prince Fielder, shortstop J. J. Hardy and third baseman Bill Hall formerly played for the Raptors. Hall of Famer Frank Robinson played for the Ogden Reds, a previous Ogden franchise in the Pioneer League.
You can download theOgden Raptorslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Ogden Raptors
item.description: The Ogden Raptors are an independent baseball team of the Pioneer League, which is not affiliated with Major League Baseball but is an MLB Partner League. They are located in Ogden, Utah, and play their home games at Lindquist Field. Pitcher Ben Sheets, first baseman Prince Fielder, shortstop J. J. Hardy and third baseman Bill Hall formerly played for the Raptors. Hall of Famer Frank Robinson played for the Ogden Reds, a previous Ogden franchise in the Pioneer League.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Omaha Storm Chasers Logo
The Omaha Storm Chasers are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Kansas City Royals. They are located in Papillion, Nebraska, a suburb southwest of Omaha, and play their home games at Werner Park which opened in 2011. The team previously played at Johnny Rosenblatt Stadium, home to the College World Series, from 1969 to 2010. The team has been the only Triple-A affiliate of the Kansas City Royals since their inception in the 1969 Major League Baseball expansion.
You can download theOmaha Storm Chaserslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Omaha Storm Chasers
item.description: The Omaha Storm Chasers are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Kansas City Royals. They are located in Papillion, Nebraska, a suburb southwest of Omaha, and play their home games at Werner Park which opened in 2011. The team previously played at Johnny Rosenblatt Stadium, home to the College World Series, from 1969 to 2010. The team has been the only Triple-A affiliate of the Kansas City Royals since their inception in the 1969 Major League Baseball expansion.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Portland Sea Dogs Logo
The Portland Sea Dogs are a Minor League Baseball team based in Portland, Maine, that plays in the Eastern League. Established in 1994, the Sea Dogs are the Double-A affiliate of the Boston Red Sox. The Sea Dogs became part of the Red Sox system for the 2003 season; previously they were affiliated with the Florida Marlins. The change in affiliation brought success in the 2005 and 2006 seasons as the Sea Dogs went to the Eastern League championship series both years.
You can download thePortland Sea Dogslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Portland Sea Dogs
item.description: The Portland Sea Dogs are a Minor League Baseball team based in Portland, Maine, that plays in the Eastern League. Established in 1994, the Sea Dogs are the Double-A affiliate of the Boston Red Sox. The Sea Dogs became part of the Red Sox system for the 2003 season; previously they were affiliated with the Florida Marlins. The change in affiliation brought success in the 2005 and 2006 seasons as the Sea Dogs went to the Eastern League championship series both years.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Richmond Flying Squirrels Logo
The Richmond Flying Squirrels are a Minor League Baseball team based in Richmond, Virginia. The team, which is a part of the Eastern League, is the Double-A affiliate of the San Francisco Giants major league club, and plays at The Diamond. The Flying Squirrels have been affiliated with the Giants since 2010, making it the longest-running active affiliation in the Giants organization among teams not owned by the Giants. The Squirrels were previously known as the Connecticut Defenders.
You can download theRichmond Flying Squirrelslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

The Flying Squirrels have been affiliated with the Giants since 2010, making it the longest-running active affiliation in the Giants organization among teams not owned by the Giants. The Squirrels were previously known as the Connecticut Defenders.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Rocky Mountain Vibes Logo
The Rocky Mountain Vibes are an independent baseball team of the Pioneer League, an MLB Partner League. They are located in Colorado Springs, Colorado, and play their home games at UCHealth Park. As a result of a contraction of Minor League Baseball in 2021, the Pioneer League, of which the Vibes have been members since 2019, was converted from an MLB-affiliated Rookie Advanced league to an independent baseball league and granted status as an MLB Partner League.
You can download theRocky Mountain Vibeslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Rocky Mountain Vibes
item.description: The Rocky Mountain Vibes are an independent baseball team of the Pioneer League, an MLB Partner League. They are located in Colorado Springs, Colorado, and play their home games at UCHealth Park. As a result of a contraction of Minor League Baseball in 2021, the Pioneer League, of which the Vibes have been members since 2019, was converted from an MLB-affiliated Rookie Advanced league to an independent baseball league and granted status as an MLB Partner League.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Salt Lake Bees Logo
The Salt Lake Bees are a Minor League Baseball team of the Pacific Coast League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Los Angeles Angels. They are located in Salt Lake City, Utah, and play their home games at Smith’s Ballpark. Known to fans as the Apiary, the ballpark opened in 1994 and has a seating capacity of 15,411, the largest in their league. The team was previously known as the Salt Lake Buzz and Salt Lake Stingers before adopting their Bees moniker in 2006.
You can download theSalt Lake Beeslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Salt Lake Bees
item.description: The Salt Lake Bees are a Minor League Baseball team of the Pacific Coast League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Los Angeles Angels. They are located in Salt Lake City, Utah, and play their home games at Smith’s Ballpark. Known to fans as the Apiary, the ballpark opened in 1994 and has a seating capacity of 15,411, the largest in their league. The team was previously known as the Salt Lake Buzz and Salt Lake Stingers before adopting their Bees moniker in 2006.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Schaumburg Boomers Logo
The Schaumburg Boomers are a professional baseball team based in Schaumburg, Illinois that began play in the independent Frontier League in 2012. The team plays its home games at Wintrust Field. The Boomers replaced the now defunct Schaumburg Flyers of the Northern League after the franchise was evicted for not paying almost US$1 million in back rent. The “Boomers” nickname comes from a common nickname for males of the greater prairie chicken species, a bird which was once abundant in the Midwest but is now a vulnerable species.
You can download theSchaumburg Boomerslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Schaumburg Boomers
item.description: The Schaumburg Boomers are a professional baseball team based in Schaumburg, Illinois that began play in the independent Frontier League in 2012. The team plays its home games at Wintrust Field. The Boomers replaced the now defunct Schaumburg Flyers of the Northern League after the franchise was evicted for not paying almost US$1 million in back rent. The “Boomers” nickname comes from a common nickname for males of the greater prairie chicken species, a bird which was once abundant in the Midwest but is now a vulnerable species.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Southern League Logo
The Southern League is a Minor League Baseball league that has operated in the Southern United States since 1964. Along with the Eastern League and Texas League, it is one of three circuits playing at the Double-A level, which is two grades below Major League Baseball. The league traces its roots to the original Southern League, the Southern Association, and the original South Atlantic League. The later circuit was renamed the Southern League in 1964, and the league elected to maintain records from that season onward.
You can download theSouthern Leaguelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Southern League
item.description: The Southern League is a Minor League Baseball league that has operated in the Southern United States since 1964. Along with the Eastern League and Texas League, it is one of three circuits playing at the Double-A level, which is two grades below Major League Baseball. The league traces its roots to the original Southern League, the Southern Association, and the original South Atlantic League. The later circuit was renamed the Southern League in 1964, and the league elected to maintain records from that season onward.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 St. Paul Saints Logo
The St. Paul Saints are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Minnesota Twins. They are located in Saint Paul, Minnesota, and have played their home games at CHS Field since 2015. They previously played at Midway Stadium from 1993 to 2014. From their founding in 1993 through 2020, the Saints were an independent baseball team with no affiliation with Major League Baseball.
You can download theSt Paul Saintslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: St Paul Saints
item.description: The St. Paul Saints are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Minnesota Twins. They are located in Saint Paul, Minnesota, and have played their home games at CHS Field since 2015. They previously played at Midway Stadium from 1993 to 2014. From their founding in 1993 through 2020, the Saints were an independent baseball team with no affiliation with Major League Baseball.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Scranton/Wilkes-Barre RailRiders Logo
The Scranton/Wilkes-Barre RailRiders are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the New York Yankees. They are located in Moosic, Pennsylvania, in the Scranton/Wilkes-Barre area, and are named in reference to Northeastern Pennsylvania being home to the first trolley system in the United States. The RailRiders have played their home games at PNC Field since its opening in 1989. Founded as members of the International League in 1989, the team was known as the Scranton/Wilkes-Barre Red Barons during their affiliation with the Philadelphia Phillies from 1989 to 2006.
You can download theSWB RailRiderslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: SWB RailRiders
item.description: The Scranton/Wilkes-Barre RailRiders are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the New York Yankees. They are located in Moosic, Pennsylvania, in the Scranton/Wilkes-Barre area, and are named in reference to Northeastern Pennsylvania being home to the first trolley system in the United States. The RailRiders have played their home games at PNC Field since its opening in 1989. Founded as members of the International League in 1989, the team was known as the Scranton/Wilkes-Barre Red Barons during their affiliation with the Philadelphia Phillies from 1989 to 2006.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Syracuse Mets Logo
The Syracuse Mets are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the New York Mets. They are located in Syracuse, New York, and play their home games at NBT Bank Stadium, which opened in 1997 and has a seating capacity of 10,815. The Mets are named for their major league affiliate and owner, the New York Mets. Throughout most of its existence, from 1934 to 1996 and again from 2007 to 2018, the team was known as the Syracuse Chiefs, while from 1997 to 2006 it was known as the Syracuse SkyChiefs.
You can download theSyracuse Metslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Syracuse Mets
item.description: The Syracuse Mets are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the New York Mets. They are located in Syracuse, New York, and play their home games at NBT Bank Stadium, which opened in 1997 and has a seating capacity of 10,815. The Mets are named for their major league affiliate and owner, the New York Mets. Throughout most of its existence, from 1934 to 1996 and again from 2007 to 2018, the team was known as the Syracuse Chiefs, while from 1997 to 2006 it was known as the Syracuse SkyChiefs.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Tacoma Rainiers Logo
The Tacoma Rainiers are a Minor League Baseball team of the Pacific Coast League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Seattle Mariners. They are located in Tacoma, Washington, and play their home games at Cheney Stadium, which opened in 1960. Tacoma has competed in the PCL since 1960, including the 2021 season when it was known as the Triple-A West. The team operated under several monikers before becoming the Rainiers in 1995.
You can download theTacoma Rainierslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Tacoma Rainiers
item.description: The Tacoma Rainiers are a Minor League Baseball team of the Pacific Coast League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Seattle Mariners. They are located in Tacoma, Washington, and play their home games at Cheney Stadium, which opened in 1960. Tacoma has competed in the PCL since 1960, including the 2021 season when it was known as the Triple-A West. The team operated under several monikers before becoming the Rainiers in 1995.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Toledo Mud Hens Logo
The Toledo Mud Hens are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Detroit Tigers. They are located in Toledo, Ohio, and play their home games at Fifth Third Field. A Mud Hens team has played in Toledo for most seasons since 1896, including a 50-year history as a member of the now defunct American Association. The current franchise was established in 1965.
You can download theToledo Mud Henslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Toledo Mud Hens
item.description: The Toledo Mud Hens are a Minor League Baseball team of the International League and the Triple-A affiliate of the Detroit Tigers. They are located in Toledo, Ohio, and play their home games at Fifth Third Field. A Mud Hens team has played in Toledo for most seasons since 1896, including a 50-year history as a member of the now defunct American Association. The current franchise was established in 1965.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Trois-Rivieres Aigles Logo
The Trois-Rivières Aigles are a Canadian professional baseball team based in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. They are members of the Frontier League, and play their home games at Stade Quillorama. The Aigles are named to honour the previous Trois-Rivières Aigles, which called the same ballpark home from 1971 until 1977 as a member of the Eastern League as an affiliate of the Cincinnati Reds. In addition, a team in the Ligue de Baseball Junior Élite du Québec bore that name, winning the 2007 pennant.
You can download theTrois-Rivieres Aigleslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Trois-Rivieres Aigles
item.description: The Trois-Rivières Aigles are a Canadian professional baseball team based in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. They are members of the Frontier League, and play their home games at Stade Quillorama. The Aigles are named to honour the previous Trois-Rivières Aigles, which called the same ballpark home from 1971 until 1977 as a member of the Eastern League as an affiliate of the Cincinnati Reds. In addition, a team in the Ligue de Baseball Junior Élite du Québec bore that name, winning the 2007 pennant.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Worcester Red Sox Logo The Worcester Red Sox are a professional minor league baseball team based in Worcester, Massachusetts. Beginning play in 2021, the team is the Triple-A affiliate of the Boston Red Sox, succeeding the Pawtucket Red Sox. The team competes in the International League, known as the Triple-A East until 2022, and plays home games at the newly constructed Polar Park in Worcester. Source
You can download theWorcester Red Soxlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Worcester Red Sox
item.description: The Worcester Red Sox are a professional minor league baseball team based in Worcester, Massachusetts. Beginning play in 2021, the team is the Triple-A affiliate of the Boston Red Sox, succeeding the Pawtucket Red Sox. The team competes in the International League, known as the Triple-A East until 2022, and plays home games at the newly constructed Polar Park in Worcester. Source
